Research

Project Research

Review at least 1 existing similar project if applicable, For each of the similar projects, please list the project name, main features, and what you can learn from this existing application. caroline
some other online booking application

Technology Research


Python vs. Java

First of all we decided on the language that we would use to implement this webapp. We narrowed the choice down to the 2 most suitable languages. After analysis of their advantages and disadvantages, we decided to choose Python.

The most notable advantages of Python over Java are as follows:

☑ All of the team are more comfortable coding in python, this is an advantage considering the time constraints for the project. The same functionality can be written in less lines in python compared to java. This will make collaboration and implementation smoother.

☑ Moorfields mentioned that, in the future, they would like to be able to do statistical analysis on the data. Python is widely used among the data science community. After considering this, it seemed that in the long term python was a better choice.

Django vs. Flask

After deciding on a language, we began by researching web frameworks best suited for our use case. We narrowed it down to two of the most popular Python frameworks, Django [1] and Flask [2].
After analysis of their advantages and disadvantages, we decided to choose Django as our web development framework. Overall, the main reasons for doing so are because Django is more of a heavy-weight framework, there are more features included in the framework that are directly relevant to us. Think of Flask as a hammer and Django as a toolbox which happens to give us everything that we need

The most notable advantages of Django over Flask are as follows:

☑ Django comes with user authentication and access levels[], which is something we would like, particularly for seperating the ocularists and admin staff at Moorfields. Flask does not come with this functionality.

☑ Django comes with an admin framework[], this is important for the longevity of the project. Users and groups can easily be edited from the admin page. This makes it easy to do things like editing passwords.

☑ Django has a built-in ORM system[] which means two things. Firstly, we don't have to write long SQL queries as database tables get directly mapped to python classes instead we can 'query' the database with readable python code. Secondly, we have freedom to choose which database to use, this gives us and future developers extra flexibility.

☑ For us Django is more secure, it is an open-source project that comes with security features [] that protect against XSS, CSRF SQL injection and clickjacking [] to name a few. Flask does not come with this functionality. If we were to use Flask there are 2 main problems. Firstly, we would have to create our own security features. We are not security professionals so there is a very high chance that they would be insecure and vulnerable to attack. Secondly, if we were to develop a secure security system, it would take too long and we would have no time for the webapp.

Bootstrap vs. React

We had to decide what tool we would use to style the webapp. We narrowed the choice down to two if the most popular tools used for frontend design, Bootstrap and React which are both used to style web pages. After analysis of their pros and cons, we decided to choose Bootstrap.

The most important advantages of Bootstrap over React are as follows:

☑ Bootstrap has more flexibility regarding screen sizes. Bootstrap utilises a grid system meaning that anything you create with Bootstrap will be compatible across different device types with different screen sizes. This is an advantage for us because at the start of the project Moorfields expressed a desire to eventually use the web app on a tablet or smartphone. Using Bootstrap means that it will be easier to implement this functionality in the future.

☑ Bootstrap works through CSS style sheets in contrast with React which uses JavaScript. All of the team is familiar with CSS and HTML and not so confident in JavaScript. This is an advantage considering the time constraints for the project. All of the team know HTML and CSS syntax so using Bootstrap will make collaboration and implementation smoother.

☑ Bootstrap provides components that can be incredibly useful us and for future developers. Components such as carousels, accordians, buttons and custom search bars can help give the ocularist power regarding the information they are accesesing.

Deployment Tools

Docker is a software platform allowing you to package your application in a isolated predictable enviroment called container.
The container contains configurations and everything needed to run the application so that you can run application in different host easily.
Docker might looks like a virtual machine but here are some key differences and advangtages:
1.Docker is free! Cost efficient haha
2.Docker is light weight and fast to boost.It takes deployment time to seconds whereas A VM can take a few minutes to be dev-ready.
3.Docker targets at Operating systems which makes docker images free of enviromental limitations and can be run everywhere.

Linode and Azure provides cloud hosting services. Both Linode and Azure has good performance but Linode is more economically efficient. Azure has better security than linode. Azure's security system has multiple layers, including key features such as Web Application vulnerability scanning, automated encryption in transit,encryption at rest and most importantly network security[4] As our application deals with sensitive patient data ,privacy is important. Therefore we choose Azure to host our application.

why did we choose sqlite?

Technical Decisions

Technology Type Decision Made
Web Development Framework Django
Language Python
Deployment Tools Docker and Azure
Front-End Development Framework Bootstrap
Database SQLite
